{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3000064,"name":"Smtopps","username":"Smtopps","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/smtopps/{size}/166758_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-29T18:49:45.631Z","cooked":"

This year we acquired the automation direct gauges and valves and I am looking to know how they get mounted. we would like to have them on a panel in roughly this orientation.

image662×682 52.5 KB

We also have the Utube connectors for them. There is more space for components such as the space between the gauge and manifold.

One way:

R810 Pressure gauges must be visable FIRST

I’m not sure if these are exactly like yours, but Triple Helix uses zip ties to a panel.

image905×690 218 KB

Pardon our messiness. We’re still under construction.

Tagging on to this, our set up looks almost identical, the premade U tube sections are a godsend for accomplishing that bend radius and the existing zip tie holds molded in the fittings are plenty for mounting it to any surface
